sections.title: Introduction to Conditional Statements
sections.content: Programs often need to make decisions based on conditions. Conditional statements allow your program to execute different code paths depending on whether certain conditions are true or false.

sections.title: Basic If Statement:
Code Blocks and Indentation
sections.content: Conditional statements create code blocks enclosed by curly brackets {}. Code inside blocks should be indented 4 spaces or 1 tab to improve readability.

sections.title: Proper Indentation:
Comparison Examples:
Else Statements
sections.content: The else statement provides an alternative code path when the if condition evaluates to false.

sections.title: If-Else Example:
Multiple Conditions: else if
sections.content: Use else if to check multiple conditions in sequence. The first condition that evaluates to true will execute, and the rest will be skipped.

sections.title: Multiple Conditions:
Order of Execution:
sections.subtitle: Important Rules:
items: Conditions are checked from top to bottom
Once a condition is true, remaining conditions are skipped

sections.title: Execution Order Example:
Comparing Strings
sections.content: Strings must be compared using the .equals() method, not the == operator. The == operator compares object references, not the actual text content.

sections.title: String Comparison:
Logical Operators
sections.content: Combine multiple conditions using logical operators: && (AND), || (OR), and ! (NOT).
